concept.title: Content reuse
concept.shortdesc: Learn best practices for reusing content to avoid problems with localization.

section.title: Handling conrefs
section.p:
You can easily reuse content in DITA with the conref attribute. Example of content referencing in DITA
Example of using the conref attribute to reuse content between topics

Improper use of content referencing can lead to translation errors (such as wrong gramamtical forms or text not matching the context). To avoid such errors, follow these rules:
Don't use conrefs for incomplete phrases. Instead, use them to reference whole sentences or larger fragments.
Avoid excessive content reuse. This can make it harder for translators to know the context of translated text.

section.title: Handling keyrefs
section.p:
You can reference keywords using the keyref attribute. Keyrefs can be used for standard text or expressions that can change, such as product names. Example of keyword referencing in DITA
Example of using keydef and keyword elements in DITA

When used improperly, keyrefs can lead to translation errors. You can minimize such errors by following these tips:
Use keyrefs for terms that do not change their grammatical form, such as product names or UI terms.
Avoid using keyrefs for common nouns.
Treat keyrefs as proper nouns and don't precede them with an article.
section.note: To avoid translation errors, it may be a good idea to resolve all conrefs and keyrefs before localizing your project.
